column6: An introduction to the classical Greek language in the context of ancient Greek culture.
A continuation of the introduction to the classical Greek language in the context of ancient Greek culture.
An introduction to the modern Greek language in the context of Greek culture.
A continuation of the introduction to the modern Greek language in the context of Greek culture.
Excerpts from classical Greek literature with emphasis on translation into English.
Excerpts from classical Greek literature with emphasis on both prose (e.g. Plato) and poetry (e.g. Euripides).
Continued development of speaking, listening, reading and writing skills using a variety of cultural materials.
Advanced readings in prose and poetry, emphasizing such 20th century demotic authors as Nikos Kazantzakis, Elias Venezis, George Seferis and Constantine Cavafy.
Selections from major prose authors. Emphasis on Attic orators and the contributions of rhetoric; also readings from ancient Greek historians especially Thucydides.
Selected New Testament readings in the original language, including the Gospels and the letters of Paul.
Readings in the original Greek of Plato's dialogues centering on the trial, conviction and death of Socrates.
Selections from the Iliad or Odyssey studied from a literary and grammatical standpoint.
Workshops individually designed to provide instruction and training in specific areas of Greek studies. S u graded.
Investigation of problems in Greek literature or linguistics.
Selections from Aeschylus, Sophocles or Euripides with discussion of Greek dramatic technique and influence.
Variable topic offered as need arises to train in specific area of field.
